However, I discovered that one email address can still receive emails. The difference I can find is that the one email address uses mbox message storage, and all the others are using maildir. Unfortunately, the option to change is grayed out so I cannot try changing it to see if that fixes any of the other addresses.

Any help on the next steps?
creator: SumoBot

title: Thunderbird + GMail + Yubikey
content:
I am am trying to configure a Gmail account in Thunderbird. I am running Thunderbird 102.6 (64 bit) on Fedora 37.

My gmail account has 2FA enabled. I use a Yubikey security key for the 2FA. During the account setup process, a window opens up asking for the gmail credentials. After entering the username and password, it opens up a page asking to insert the security key. However on doing so, nothing happens further. And the login process eventually times out.

The issue seems to be very similar to one reported here - https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/issues/87642. Not sure if the solution or the discussion is relevant - but the original post is pretty much describing the same issue I am seeing.

The expected behavior is that the Yubikey blinks, waiting for you to touch the button to complete the 2FA process. This is what I see when i try to login via a web browser (Firefox, Vivaldi).

I suspect something on Thunderbird (in combination with Fedora 37) is preventing Thunderbird from recognizing the Yubikey during the setup process.
creator: SumoBot

title: TBird is over-counting new emails in my gmail account
content:

I'd prefer it only counts the Inbox so when the account is not expanded, I see a true number of new emails.

title: saved mail gets overwritten
content:
Dear all, I've noticed a similar, rather serious problem with Thunderbird, first using it on MacBook Pro, now using ThinkPad with Windows 11 Pro. The Thunderbird used is 102.6.1 (64 bits).

The problem: a mail read and moved from Inbox to another folder, gets overwritten by another mail saved in the same folder. Overwritten is only the content, while in the list of mails in the folder the sender, subject and date are still different. Overwriting does not happen when either of mails is moved to the destination folder, but at a later time. I don't think I can reproduce mail management that I did at the time the error happens, however I do not think I did anything strange. It is true that my email structure consists of around 100 folders with thousands of emails (unfortunate byproduct of my job description).

I guess I do not need to state how serious this potential bug (or my mistake, perhaps...) is. The first time I attributed it to a perhaps non-perfect compatibility of Mac version of the Thunderbird with its OS, however the error being repeated at two different systems rules this out.

Clearly the suggestions (or requests for further info) are welcome.

Best regards, Bostjan Golob
creator: golobgm

title: Receive "The server had an internal error... always a problem of the server..." when trying to move inbox messages to folder
content:
I manage multiple email accounts with Thunderbird and use message filters and subfolder extensively to keep my mail organized. I move messages to the subfolders with filters and manually. Until about 3 days ago, all worked well. However, one of my accounts - and Office 365 Exchange Server POP3 Account that I access with the OWL add-on - will no longer allow me to move message out of the inbox folder into subfolders. The message filters are not working either for this one account.

The full text of the message displayed is: "The server had an internal error. This is always a problem of the server and not of you or your application."

The other POP3 accounts allow for message transfer to subfolders and the filters work fine. Not sure where the problem lies here - whether it is OWL, Thunderbird, or the Exchange Server. I checked an I am running the latest version of Thunderbird and the latest version of OWL. I have reinstalled Thunderbird and restarted but no luck. Is it possible some configuration file has gotten corrupted?

Any thoughts or support would be much appreciated.
creator: jaswartz55

title: Thunderbird keeps creating duplicate emails when accessing the Hotmail server after last Thunderbird update.
